transcription_sentences.speaker: sales_rep
transcription_sentences.text: Hi, is this Zhi? This is Arjun calling from MongoDB. Did I catch you at a decent time?

transcription_sentences.speaker: prospect
transcription_sentences.text: Hey Arjun, yeah, I’ve got a couple of minutes before my next meeting. What’s up?

transcription_sentences.speaker: sales_rep
transcription_sentences.text: Great, I’ll keep it brief. I noticed Acme Corp’s gaming platform is running on MongoDB on-prem, and I heard about some recent scaling challenges you’ve been facing. Is that something you’re still running into?

transcription_sentences.speaker: prospect
transcription_sentences.text: Yeah, scaling’s been rough. We had a spike last weekend that nearly took us down.

transcription_sentences.speaker: sales_rep
transcription_sentences.text: That sounds stressful. Sorry to hear it. Have you explored moving to MongoDB Atlas in the cloud? It can autoscale with your player base.

transcription_sentences.speaker: prospect
transcription_sentences.text: We’ve looked a little, but honestly, the migration seems risky. We can’t afford any downtime, and our compliance team is pretty nervous about cloud security.

transcription_sentences.speaker: sales_rep
transcription_sentences.text: Yeah, those are fair concerns. Atlas does offer zero-downtime migration tools and is certified for most gaming industry compliance standards—SOC2, ISO, that kind of thing. Would you be open to a security deep dive?

transcription_sentences.speaker: prospect
transcription_sentences.text: I mean, maybe later, but—and don’t take this the wrong way—I just don’t trust having core data outside our environment. It’s not just compliance, it’s… just, we’ve been burned before.

transcription_sentences.speaker: sales_rep
transcription_sentences.text: Totally, totally get that. Out of curiosity, are you seeing any pain points with monitoring, backups, or performance tuning on-prem?

transcription_sentences.speaker: prospect
transcription_sentences.text: Honestly, yeah, but we have a lot of home-grown scripts and processes. It’s not beautiful, but it works, and at least we know where everything is.

transcription_sentences.speaker: sales_rep
transcription_sentences.text: That makes sense. Would it help if we did a risk assessment to compare cloud and on-prem for your use case? No pressure, just some data points.

transcription_sentences.speaker: prospect
transcription_sentences.text: Honestly, Arjun, we’re just not looking to switch right now. Even if the numbers look good, there’s too much at stake for us with a migration.

transcription_sentences.speaker: sales_rep
transcription_sentences.text: Understood. If it’s not the right time, I don’t want to push.

transcription_sentences.speaker: prospect
transcription_sentences.text: Yeah, appreciate that. Maybe down the road, just not now.

transcription_sentences.speaker: sales_rep
transcription_sentences.text: No worries, Zhi. Mind if I check in in a few months to see if anything’s changed?

transcription_sentences.speaker: prospect
transcription_sentences.text: Sure, that’s fine. Thanks for understanding, Arjun.

transcription_sentences.speaker: sales_rep
transcription_sentences.text: Of course. Good luck with the next launch!
